item.title: Violent Video Game Tax Is Getting Closer to Reality
item.description:
Mexico has moved a step closer to taxing violent video games after the Chamber of Deputies approved one such levy as part of a broader fiscal package. The legislative proposal now heads to the Senate, raising the possibility of higher prices and increased regulatory scrutiny in one of Latin America’s biggest gaming markets.

A 2025 report by Human Rights Watch states that Mexico continues to experience "extremely high rates" of homicide and other violent crimes. The trend peaked in 2022, when six Mexican cities recorded homicide rates exceeding 100 per 100,000 residents. Nationally, the homicide rate has declined slightly in recent years and currently stands at around 25 per 100,000. However, an increase in reported disappearances during the same period suggests that the true rate of homicides may not have changed significantly, if at all. Much of the country's violence has been linked to drug cartels, which have proven difficult for the government to crack down on over the years.

Mexico's Chamber of Deputies Approves 8% Tax on Violent Video Games

While the video game industry's connection to real-life violence is much more dubious, it makes for an easier legislative target. It has now found itself in the crosshairs of the Mexican parliament, whose lower house—the Chamber of Deputies—voted to approve an 8% levy on violent video games on October 17. The measure was bundled into Mexico’s 2026 Economic Package proposal, presented as part of "health taxes," which also include higher levies on sugary drinks, tobacco, and gambling.

Mexico's New Tax Proposal Also Targeting Other Types of Video Games

The proposal can more accurately be described as a mature video game tax, as it doesn't just target violent titles but any with the C (18+) and D (adult-only) ratings defined by the Mexican System of Equivalences of Video Game Content Classification. The first draft of the law was originally introduced on September 14, with a budget presentation from the Treasury Department claiming "recent studies have found a relationship between the use of violent video games and higher levels of aggression among adolescents, as well as negative social and psychological effects such as isolation and anxiety." No concrete studies were cited in the presentation.

What's Next for Mexico’s 2026 Economic Package Proposal

The proposal now heads to the Senate, where it is expected to be discussed in the coming weeks. The Congress of the Union has a November 15 deadline for deciding whether to enact the legislation. The current draft isn't clear on whether the levy would apply to both physical and digital sales, and where it stands on things like subscriptions, DLC, and other types of microtransactions. Should the general proposal be accepted, the Senate's version of the law is likely to clarify those questions.

The violent video game tax would be stacked on top of Mexico's existing VAT, which has been sitting at 16% since 2010. The Treasury Department said the reasoning behind the measure was to raise resources for helping people suffering from negative social and psychological effects that it blames on video games.

Sources: Human Rights Watch, Insider Gaming

item.title: Best 2D Turn-Based RPGs
item.description:
Turn-based RPGs technically started in 2D , but that was due to console limitations. Classics like Chrono Trigger or Final Fantasy 6 aren’t quite 2D RPGs the same way Super Mario World is a 2D platformer. There are a lot of great 2D action RPGs to check out, though, including Dragon’s Crown and the River City Girls games.

Are there any turn-based 2D RPGs in the more traditional sense? There are indeed, made in both the East and the West, and a good number of them are the best of the best. Across all platforms, 2D gaming fans are going to love these RPGs.

Indivisible

Borrowing From Two Of The Best

Indivisible
Action RPG
Systems
Released
October 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Blood, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Indivisible is an indie RPG where the main character, Ajna, can call forth spirits of the past to aid her in battle. Each character is placed onto a face button in battle, and players can build combos if they time their button presses right.

It’s a similar battle system to Valkyrie Profile on the PS1. The overworld is a 2D-like maze akin to a Metroidvania, complete with traversal powers, so it’s like two great genres were combined into one.

Child Of Light

Another UbiArt Classic

Child of Light
6 /10
4.0 /10
Released
April 30, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco
Powered by

Ubisoft fans may enjoy exploring 3D RPGs like Tom Clancy’s The Division or Assassin’s Creed Shadows , but they are missing out on a forgotten 2D classic. Child of Light used the UbiArt engine, which also powered Rayman Origins; in other words, it looks like great 2D art.

This haunting tale stars a princess in a crumbling land, where each battle is harder than the last. Every move, from attacks to abilities, has a timer that can interrupt the enemy's turns or be interrupted by enemies. This mechanic adds more strategy to the platforming gameplay.

The Cruel King And The Great Hero

Even Little Girls Can Save Monsters

The Cruel King and the Great Hero

Released
June 24, 2021
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch
Powered by

As obscure an RPG company as NIS is, The Cruel King and the Great Hero is one of their most underrated games. The artwork looks like it was drawn using crayons and pencils, giving it a very distinct style. Players control a young girl, Yuu, who gains monster allies as she explores new regions of the world.

Monsters are misunderstood, and with Yuu’s help, she will bridge the gap between them and humans. Yuu can travel up and down in each area, but the game is still overall in 2D, with areas separated by screens rather than a world map connecting locations.

Miitopia

Look At Mii!

Miitopia
6 /10
10 /10
Released
July 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Crude Humor, Mild Cartoon Violence
Powered by

Miitopia began as a 3DS RPG before being retooled for the Switch. The game’s big gimmick revolves around player-created Miis who appear as party members and monsters. This made more sense on the 3DS, since it pulled Miis from others who players met on SpotPass to populate the world.

This discrepancy makes the Switch version a lesser experience, but a more accessible one. Either way, Miitopia is a lighthearted RPG designed fully in 2D, with the gameplay being mostly composed of battles without offering many ways to explore environments.

Cris Tales

Time Has Meaning

Cris Tales
RPG
Systems
Released
July 20, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Cris Tales is one of those modern turn-based RPGs that starts a bit slow, but given time, it will sink its hooks into players. That’s fitting, as the game is a time-traveling RPG that incorporates that theme into battle.

Crisbell, the protagonist, can divide the game's turn-based battles into past, present, or future segments, which will affect enemies. An enemy may be strong in the present, but they may be feeble in the future or a novice in the past. It’s a system that's a bit hard to get used to, but it’s a deep turn-based game with strategic depth that is worth investing in.

SteamWorld Quest: Hand Of Gilgamech

Robots, Dungeons, And Dragons

SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech
RPG
Adventure
Strategy
Systems
Released
April 25, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

The great thing about the SteamWorld series is that the developer, Image & Form Games, is always experimenting with genres and settings. SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech is a turn-based fantasy game with card-based gameplay.

Moves are calculated using cards in battle, but there are also controllable robotic characters, so it’s not exclusively a deck-building game. While not as popular as SteamWorld Dig or SteamWorld Heist , SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech is an underrated gem just waiting to be tackled by 2D fans.

Monster Sanctuary

A PokeVania

Monster Sanctuary
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
August 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Monster Sanctuary blends Metroidvanias with monster-catching games like Pokemon into something truly innovative. Players can explore and gain items or abilities to help with traversing the environment, a formula typical of Metroidvanias.

When monsters are encountered, battles transition to turn-based mechanics where players can issue orders to their monster party. It’s a shame Game Freak hasn’t tried a Metroidvania hybrid with their Pokemon series yet, as Monster Sanctuary proves it’s a solid genre combination.

Astria Ascending

From Mobile To Console

Astria Ascending
RPG
Systems
Released
September 30, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Astria Ascending is a unique RPG because it began as a mobile game before being revamped for a bigger console release. It’s also odd because players start with a large number of party members and have to decide who to bring along through trial and error.

With hand-drawn graphics and a vibrant 2D world, this RPG will pop on any system where players engage with it. From battles to exploring, everything found in Astria Ascending is in glorious 2D.

item.title: Borderlands 4 Players Have Until October 20 to Redeem 3 More Shift Codes
item.description:
Borderlands 4 is offering players 3 new SHiFT codes that can be redeemed right now for Golden Keys. Any Borderlands 4 players looking to get in on this loot while it's available will need to redeem these SHiFT codes before they expire on October 20.

Loot is a huge part of the Borderlands 4 experience, and the Golden Keys earned through SHiFT codes give players the chance to earn Borderlands 4 's coveted Legendary weapons from Golden Chests found in major in-game settlements: Belton's Bore, Carcadia, The Lockaway, and The Launchpad. By linking the account of their platform of choice with the SHiFT website, Borderlands 4 players can enter these codes and receive Golden Keys delivered directly to their inventory.

Borderlands 4 Players Can Claim 3 New SHiFT Codes for Golden Keys

  • TZR3T-JZJKJ-WXJTC-T33TB-RFCFR
  • 3S6TT-CZJWT-WXJT5-3B3BJ-JS3JZ
  • J96BJ-RZJWB-C6TJC-BBJJJ-5B5W9

Gearbox CEO Randy Pitchford is offering 3 new SHiFT codes via his X account: TZR3T-JZJKJ-WXJTC-T33TB-RFCFR , 3S6TT-CZJWT-WXJT5-3B3BJ-JS3JZ , and J96BJ-RZJWB-C6TJC-BBJJJ-5B5W9 . These codes can only be redeemed for 48 hours after they were posted, which was approximately 2:09PM PT on October 18, making October 20 the deadline. Each one grants a single Golden Key, which can only be used in Borderlands 4 to open a Golden Chest once, though each chest has the potential to offer multiple Legendary pieces of gear.

Redeeming a SHiFT code is fairly simple once players have linked the account of their desired platform to the redemption website. Players simply need to enter the code as written (copy and pasting works, too), then click the "Check" button to confirm that the SHiFT code is still valid. Once validated, players will be prompted to select which platform they would like the reward to be redeemed on. After making this selection, players should be able to open their Borderlands 4 game and find the newly added Golden Keys in their inventory under the dollar sign tab that displays their currency.

SHiFT codes granting players Golden Keys have long been a staple of the Borderlands series, and are a particular favorite freebie of the community. Since Borderlands 4 's launch, Gearbox and Pitchford have been very generous with the number of Golden Keys being given away via SHiFT codes, and players who miss out on these codes' October 20 deadline can rest assured that more SHiFT codes are likely coming in another week.

Additionally, players have been able to participate in community challenges for the chance to earn SHiFT codes that unlock special Vault Hunter skins. Rafa's Savings Savor skin, Amon's Cult Classic skin, and Vex's Mass Market Appeal skins are all available for free as a result of players meeting their associated community challenge milestones. The current community challenge unlocks a SHiFT code for Harlowe's Maliwannabee skin if players can collectively complete 350,000 contracts as the Vault Hunter by October 19.

30
8.2 /10
8 /10

Borderlands 4

item.title: Roblox: Kick a Brainrot Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Kick a Brainrot is a tycoon game that takes the popular Roblox concept of hatching creatures from eggs and raising them on a farm. However, the developers wanted to make the game unique, so they added cool mechanics that greatly increase the variety of gameplay. The main mechanic is described in the title: you need to kick a brainrot creature to add value to it. There are also mini-events that change the appearance of the map and add new eggs.

To make it easier for beginners to play, the developers have added a code redemption option. If you want to get cool rewards for free, redeem Kick a Brainrot codes from our list.

Updated October 18, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: A fresh set of rewards is now available, offering extra cash boosts for your progress. These bonuses can give you a helpful advantage while you play, adding a bit more to your in-game resources. If you’ve already claimed previous rewards, these new additions are worth checking out. More updates may be added soon, so it’s a good idea to return regularly to see the latest freebies.

All Kick a Brainrot Codes

Working Kick a Brainrot Codes

  • 90KLIKES - Redeem this code to get 1h Cash Boost. (NEW)
  • 25MVISITS - Redeem this code to get 1h Luck Boost. (NEW)

Expired Kick a Brainrot Codes

  • 85KLIKES
  • 300KMEMBERS
  • 80KLIKES
  • 20MVISITS
  • 70KLIKES
  • 250KMEMBERS
  • 5MVISITS
  • 25KLIKES
  • 1MVISITS
  • 10KLIKES

By redeeming Kick a Brainrot codes, you can get a rare egg or some in-game currency. So, regardless of your experience in the game, it will be useful to get a little freebie.

How to Redeem Codes in Kick a Brainrot

In most Roblox games, redeeming codes is straightforward. In this game, the “Codes” button is located directly in the game interface, making it easy to use. However, it is easy for newcomers to overlook, so to assist you, we have created a guide explaining how to redeem codes in Kick a Brainrot :

  • Launch Roblox and open Kick a Brainrot .
  • Look at the right side of the screen. Click the purple Codes button.
  • Paste the code from the list of working codes into the text field and click the checkmark button.

Remember, codes expire over time, so you need to redeem them as soon as possible to get rewards.

How to Get More Kick a Brainrot Codes

Sometimes you can find Roblox codes right in the game or on the page, but that's a rare thing. Usually, to find codes, you have to search for them in developers' social media accounts or on various gaming websites, and often, they are no longer valid. We regularly update our guides and add new working codes. To make sure you don't miss out on gifts, we recommend bookmarking this guide in your browser using the Ctrl+D key combination. But if you're more interested in the developers' social media accounts, you can follow the links below:

  • Kick a Brainrot Roblox game page
  • Kick a Brainrot Roblox group
  • Kick a Brainrot Discord server
Roblox

item.title: Roblox: Ultimate Football Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Football has always been popular in the gaming industry, with many fans enjoying their favorite game on the Roblox platform. The Ultimate Football developers have created a great game in which Roblox players have to try their best to win on the football field. To reward fans who enjoy the game, the developers also release Ultimate Football codes, all of which can be found below.

Updated October 18, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: A new update has introduced fresh rewards for you to claim, making it a great time to check the latest bonuses. These freebies include useful in-game items and currency that can help you progress faster. If you’ve already redeemed older ones, don’t miss the opportunity to grab the newest additions. More rewards may appear soon, so it’s worth coming back later to see what’s next.

Just like in many other Roblox games, the developers have added a huge number of codes, but most of them have already expired. Below is a list of all active codes, but they may also expire soon, so hurry up and get the rewards.

Codes Checked on October 18, 2025.

How to Redeem Codes in Ultimate Football

Similar to many Roblox games, the button to redeem codes can be found in the in-game menu. It is quite easy to find, and this is what players need to do:

  1. Open Roblox and launch Ultimate Football .
  2. Next, in the main menu, go to the Store tab.
  3. Go to the Redeem a Code section.
  4. Enter or paste the code in the Insert Code Here field and click on the tick. After that, the reward will be received.

Note that players who have just started playing the game will not be able to redeem codes. They must first spend 3 hours in Park Mode for this option to become available.

Roblox is home to an ever-expanding library of community-created worlds and experiences. Whether you’re in the mood for an epic role-playing adventure game or just want to hang out with your friends, there’s always something new and exciting to play.
Connect with friends and millions of players from around the world across Xbox One, computers, smartphones, tablets, and virtual reality devices.
Mix-and-match accessories, body parts, and more to customize your avatar. You can be anything you want to be: a ninja pirate, a mermaid princess, a robot wizard, the possibilities are limitless.
